title: Apple’s ‘life-changing’ products
text:
Apple’s big September event: iPhone 6s, bigger iPad and new Apple TV HARRY TUCKER news.com.au Apple’s big September event: iPhone 6s, bigger iPad and new Apple TV HARRY TUCKER news.com.au Apple unveils iPhone 6S, 6S Plus 1:27 
The latest iteration of Apple's iPhone offers 3D touch, a display technology that responds differently depending on how hard users press their screens. September 10th 2015 3 hours ago /video/video.news.com.au/News/ 
APPLE has showed off two new iPhones, a bigger iPad and an updated Apple TV during its biggest day of product announcements this year. 
“We are about to make some monster announcements across several of our product lines,” Apple CEO Tim Cook said at the start of proceedings. He wasn’t lying. 
The new iPad Pro boasts more power and better performance than any other before it, and features a super sharp 12.9-inch screen that can fit a full-size virtual keyboard. Apple CEO Tim Cook shows off the iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus This is what happens when you press down on the Safari icon. This is the new Rose Gold iPhone 6s colour. The iPad Pro on the right next to the old iPad Air on the left. The specs for the new iPad Pro. Apple has reinvented... the pencil? The new Hermes leather watch bands look great. 1 of n 
While the new iPhones may look almost identical to last year’s models, practically everything else about them has been changed drastically. 
A new Apple TV has finally been announced too, with a focus on apps, powerful new hardware and a new user interface. Other Stories
